Headlines: Infectious Diseases: October 30, 2004
Teaser: Dr. Bartlett reviews the latest on influenza, antibiotic tx guidelines, MRSA, hepatitis B, West Nile virus, smallpox vaccination, Crohn's disease, C difficile, prions, rhinovirus, & more.

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Influenza Vaccination in Pregnancy
Teaser: Are enough family physicians and obstetricians recommending the vaccine to expectant mothers in their second or third trimester when risk is greatest?

Headlines: Bacterial Meningitis: A Deadly But Preventable Disease
Teaser: Those whose lives have been touched by this lethal disease call for greater awareness, better prevention efforts, and more accurate diagnosis and treatment.

Headlines: Hepatitis Vaccination in Patients With Chronic Liver Disease
Teaser: Despite a declining incidence of acute viral hepatitis in recent years, it remains the most common cause of chronic liver disease world-wide.

Headlines: Emerging Infections
Teaser: Dr. John Bartlett reports on the latest data from IDSA on SARS, monkeypox, and other emerging infectious disease threats.

Headlines: New Organisms, New Drugs, New Tests, New Guidelines: What Do You Really Need to Know?
Teaser: What do infectious disease clinicians need to take away from IDSA? Henry Masur, MD, provides a succinct overview of key clinical data and discussions from this important annual meeting.

Headlines: Asthma and Influenza Vaccination
Teaser: The public health burden attributable to asthma in the United States is considerable and is growing.

Headlines: Some Answers to Smallpox Vaccination Questions
Teaser: The progress of the U.S. smallpox vaccination effort has been difficult to follow in the media.

Headlines: Flu Vaccine for Cardiovascular Prevention in the Elderly
Teaser: Influenza is linked with increased risk for adverse cardiovascular events.

Headlines: October 2002
Teaser: Read about the new drug approval for Hepsera for chronic hepatitis B and other recent FDA approvals and labeling changes.

Headlines: Special Report: Adult Vaccines -- New ACIP Recommendations
Teaser: New recommendations for already approved vaccines and a newly approved vaccine for meningococcal B infections -- what you need to know.

Headlines: Condoms Prevent HSV-2 Acquisition
Teaser: Can condoms prevent spread of HSV-2? 1843 participants who had no luck with a vaccine were evaluated.

Headlines: Influenza Vaccination Levels - United States, 2003
Teaser: To improve overall influenza vaccination coverage, combinations of evidence-based effective interventions should be implemented, and the influenza vaccine supply should be stabilized.

Headlines: Response Plans Prepare for Avian Influenza Outbreak
Teaser: The growing threat of an avian influenza pandemic has international public health officials preparing for a potentially catastrophic flu strain.

Headlines: siRNA in Prophylactic and Therapeutic Regimens Against SARS
Teaser: Development of therapeutic agents for severe acute respiratory syndrome viral infection using short interfering RNA inhibitors exemplifies a powerful new means to combat emerging infectious diseases.

Headlines: Epidemiology of Hepatitis A Transformed by Vaccine
Teaser: Herd protection induced by vaccinating toddlers against hepatitis A is dramatic, according to well designed Israeli study. U.S. data presented in same issue of JAMA.

Headlines: Unable to Provide Vaccines due to Insurance Payments
Teaser: In California, insurance companies control the quality of medical care. Now, through economics, the insurance industry is making it impossible to deliver adequate immunizations.

Headlines: Bartlett Infectious Diseases Review: May 31, 2005
Teaser: Dr. Bartlett reviews pertussis prev/tx, purpura fulminans due to S aureus, tx for Legionnaires disease, impact of vancomycin resistance on enterococcal bacteremia, entecavir for HBV, and much more.

Headlines: Bartlett Infectious Diseases Review: May 15, 2005
Teaser: Dr. Bartlett reviews the latest on flu vaccination efficacy in various age groups, new pneumonia treatment guidelines from ATS/IDSA, antifungal treatment, E coli outbreaks, and more.

Headlines: Tetanus and Diphtheria: An Expert Interview With Susan Rehm, MD
Teaser: What physicians don't know about tetanus and diphtheria boosters may hurt their patients.

Headlines: Development of A Vaccine to Prevent Human Immunodeficiency Virus
Teaser: Current strategies being investigated in the development of preventive HIV vaccines are reviewed.

Headlines: Bartlett Infectious Diseases Review: April 15, 2005
Teaser: Dr. Bartlett reviews the latest data on the 2004-2005 US flu season, impact of pneumococcal vaccination on macrolide resistance, heptavalent cholera vaccine, and more.

Headlines: Fact Sheet:Immunizations for Older Adults
Teaser: Older adults can reduce their risk of several life-threatening diseases through immunizations. Vaccines are safe and effective, and are covered by Medicare.

Headlines: Bartlett Infectious Diseases Review: December 31, 2004
Teaser: Dr. Bartlett reviews the latest on influenza, gemifloxacin, drug resistance, poliomyelitis vaccination/epidemiology, S aureus & C difficile in pseudomembranous intestinal diseases, & more.

Headlines: Low Doses of Intradermal Flu Vaccine Perform Well
Teaser: Although the findings need clinical confirmation, these studies join others in suggesting that intradermal administration of the flu vaccine could stretch a limited supply.

Headlines: Vaccine Prevents HPV Infection and Early Cervical Lesions
Teaser: The HPV vaccine is likely to become the first licensed vaccine to prevent this common sexually transmitted disease. Larger, longer trials are needed to demonstrate that it can prevent cervical cancer.

Headlines: Mortality Benefit of Repeat Flu Vaccination in Elders
Teaser: This observational study cannot establish causality but does associate a cumulative survival advantage among healthy elders with yearly vaccinations.

Headlines: Influenza Vaccine Recommendations: A Moving Target
Teaser: Each practice should keep lists of high-risk, eligible patients by diagnosis, so that rapid notification is possible.

Headlines: Effects of Annual Flu Vaccine on Winter Mortality in Elderly With CHD
Teaser: Annual flu vaccination is recommended for the elderly, but do elderly persons with chronic heart disease (CHD) have the same mortality risk as their counterparts who do not receive a flu shot?

Headlines: Pregnant Women and the Flu Vaccine
Teaser: In her latest videoblog, Dr. Sandra Fryhofer recommends that pregnant women should receive the flu shot.

Headlines: Prevalence and Correlates of Previous HBV Vaccination Among Young Drug-user
Teaser: Hepatitis B vaccination is recommended for children aged 0-18 years and is required for middle school entry in many states. What are the correlates of immunization among younger and older drug users?

Headlines: Evaluating HPV Vaccination Programs: Pay for Voluntary Adult Vaccination?
Teaser: Should an adult human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccination program supplement childhood vaccination? Is eradication of targeted types possible for HPV vaccines with suboptimal efficacy or immunogenicity?

Headlines: Risk Factors for Meningococcal Disease in Students in Grades 9-12
Teaser: Most meningococcal disease in high school students can be prevented if recommendations on use of meningococcal conjugate vaccine are implemented.

Headlines: Prophylaxsis Against Recurrance of HBV After LT: Retrospective Analysis
Teaser: Liver transplantation in patients with hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection is associated with a high rate of graft loss and poor survival, unless re-infection can be prevented. Is prophylaxis effective?

Headlines: Influenza vaccination in subjects with alpha1-antitrypsin deficiency
Teaser: Do patients with AATD in the United States receive adequate influenza vaccination regardless of age?

Headlines: Efficacy of Influenza Vaccination in HIV-positive Patients
Teaser: Is there reasonable evidence that influenza vaccinations are effective in HIV-positive patients?

Headlines: Personality, Psychological Stress, and Self-reported Flu Symptomatology
Teaser: Does perceived stress predict self-reported influenza-like illness? What are the roles of negative affectivity and social inhibition in influenza-like illness?

Headlines: Febrile Respiratory Symptoms in HIV: Think Flu
Teaser: HIV-infected outpatients presenting with fever and respiratory symptoms could have influenza. What is the actual incidence of the flu in such patients and what impact does flu vaccination have?

Headlines: Use of Meningococcal Vaccines in the United States
Teaser: MCV4 should become a key addition to existing meningococcal disease prevention measures.

Headlines: Intradermal Hepatitis B Vaccine With Advanced Chronic Renal Failure
Teaser: Patients undergoing dialysis usually have a poor response to conventional hepatitis B vaccination.

Headlines: Human-Bovine Reassortant Rotavirus Vaccine
Teaser: The vaccine appears to be highly effective and well tolerated.

Headlines: Intradermal vs Intramuscular Vaccination Against HBV
Teaser: Dialysis patients have suboptimal response towards hepatitis B virus vaccine.

Headlines: Influenza: June 2006
Teaser: Dr. John G. Bartlett reviews the literature: recent avian influenza reports from ProMED, global influenza preparedness planning -- antivirals and vaccines, influenza pathogenesis, and more.

Headlines: How Long Will Vaccines Against HPV Remain Effective?
Teaser: HPV vaccines may reduce incidence of cervical cancer by 70% or more. Does protection last 4 years? Even longer? Does the bivalent vaccine provide cross-protection against other HPV strains?

Headlines: Smallpox: May 2006
Teaser: Dr. John G. Bartlett reviews articles on smallpox from the CDC: guidance on criteria for smallpox diagnosis and expedited reporting to public health authorities and complications of vaccination.

Headlines: Epidemiology of HPV 16 and Cervical Cancer
Teaser: Using a mathematical model of transmission of HPV 16 infection and progression to cervical cancer, Ruanne Barnabas and colleagues show that HPV vaccination could significantly decrease HPV type-specific cervical cancer incidence.

Headlines: Influenza: February 2006
Teaser: Dr. John G. Bartlett reviews the literature: history of influenza pandemics, the latest data and expert opinion on pharmacologic and nonpharmacologic treatment/prevention of avian influenza, and more.

Headlines: How Safe Is the HPV Vaccine?
Teaser: Dr. Maurie Markman highlights the results of a surveillance study on the safety of the HPV vaccine in his latest video blog.

Headlines: Quadrivalent HPV Vaccine: Not Just for Younger Women
Teaser: Should quadrivalent HPV vaccine be used in older women up to their mid-forties? Dr. Andrew Kaunitz discusses the latest research results and potential adverse effects in this video blog.

Headlines: Prevention of Hepatocellular Carcinoma in Hepatitis B Virus Infection
Teaser: This article assesses HBV vaccination program strategies in Asia in preventing chronic HBV infection and hepatocellular carcinoma and reviews strategies in controlling liver disease in chronic HBV.

Headlines: Determining the Genetic Origin of the 2009 A(H1N1) "Swine" Flu
Teaser: Dr. Ali Torkamani comments on a study published in Science discussing the genetic origin of the 2009 "swine flu" and the implications for future flu surveillance.

Headlines: Efficacy of HPV Vaccine Confirmed for Women Over 25 Years of Age
Teaser: Initial studies of HPV vaccines were conducted in very young subjects. Now, a trial confirms that infection can also be prevented in those older than 25, says Dr. Maurie Markman in this video blog.

Headlines: Flu Shot May be Less Effective After Transplant
Teaser: Kidney transplant patients have a weaker response to influenza immunization than healthy individuals, according to a study published in the July issue of the American Journal of Kidney Diseases.

Headlines: ASCO 2009: Expert Video Perspective on Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Find out why Dr. Christopher Logothetis reports that we are on the "threshold of major change" in our understanding of prostate cancer, in this report from ASCO 2009.

Headlines: As Novel H1N1 Influenza Reaches Pandemic Level, Public Health Preparedness Efforts Build
Teaser: A multidisciplinary expert panel on Human Swine Flu (H1N1) and Novel Influenza Pandemics held at NYAS drew attention to worldwide, national, and local surveillance and preparedness efforts.

Headlines: Vaccines in Adult Patients With Rheumatic Disease: Balancing Risks and Benefits
Teaser: Clinicians should take special precautions when immunizing patients with rheumatic disease, but they should not ignore the potential health benefits of particular vaccines.

Headlines: Is Adult Pneumococcal Vaccine Ineffective? A Best Evidence Review
Teaser: A meta-analysis calls into question the current standard of care for use of pneumococcal vaccine in adults.

Headlines: Influenza Activity, US, September 2008-April 2009; 2009-10 Vaccine Composition
Teaser: What was the reported influenza activity during this time and what is the 2009-2010 influenza vaccine strain selection?

Headlines: Use of Northern Hemisphere Flu Vaccines by Travelers to Southern Hemisphere
Teaser: What are the ACIP recommendations for influenza vaccination for persons from the northern hemisphere who are planning travel to the southern hemisphere or tropics?

Headlines: Is Gardasil Recommended for Young Women Already Exposed to HPV?
Teaser: Many clinicians are uncertain as to whether they should recommend Gardasil vaccination to young women who have already tested positive for human papillomavirus or who have had an abnormal Pap test.

Source: Seminars in Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine
Headlines: Streptococcus pneumoniae
Teaser: Streptococcus pneumoniae is the most common cause of community-acquired pneumonia, meningitis, and bacteremia in children and adults

Headlines: A Re-emerging Infection?
Teaser: A 38-year-old female with a two-week history of amoxicillin use for fever, cough, and coryza presented with two days of erythematous chest macules.

Headlines: Promising Novel Immunotherapies and Combinations for Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Therapeutic cancer vaccine research is in the active preclinical and clinical investigation stages. Novel therapies have recently come to the forefront of prostate cancer research.

Headlines: Trials and Tribulations of HIV Vaccines
Teaser: Where do we currently stand with HIV vaccines and what will the future bring?

Headlines: Hepatitis E Vaccine: Current Status and Future Prospects
Teaser: What are the latest updates on the development of the hepatitis E vaccine?

Headlines: Prophylactic Vaccinations in COPD
Teaser: Medications to treat COPD exacerbations are limited; therefore, identifying effective ways to prevent exacerbations are needed.

Headlines: Experience With Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine in Norway
Teaser: The implementation of the seven-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (PCV7) has led to major reductions in pneumonia infection among Norwegian children.

Headlines: 2009 H1N1 Influenza -- Just the Facts: Vaccine Essentials
Teaser: John G. Bartlett, MD, updates his report on the 2009 H1N1 vaccine with the latest summary of VAERS data.

Headlines: CDC Commentary: Seasonal and H1N1 Influenza Vaccines -- Timing of Doses
Teaser: What is the optimal spacing and timing of the seasonal and H1N1 influenza vaccines? In this video blog, William Atkinson, MD, MPH, offers specific guidance from the CDC.

Headlines: Update on Influenza A (H1N1) 2009 Monovalent Vaccines
Teaser: Preliminary data indicate that the immunogenicity and safety of the H1N1 vaccines are similar to those of seasonal influenza vaccines.

Headlines: Cross-Reactivity to 2009 H1N1 Influenza Virus
Teaser: Does anyone -- young or old -- have preexisting immunity to H1N1?

Headlines: Good News and Bad News About 2009 H1N1 Influenza ("Swine Flu")
Teaser: The bad news: antibodies against H1N1 are rarely found in stored serum US samples. The good news: H1N1 vaccine easily elicits them.

Headlines: CDC Commentary: 2009 H1N1 Influenza Vaccine in Pregnancy
Teaser: Pregnant women are 1 of the 5 initial target groups for the 2009 H1N1 influenza vaccine. In this video commentary, Sonja Rasmussen, MD, MS, Senior Scientist at CDC, reviews the latest guidelines.

Headlines: Comparative Efficacy of Influenza Vaccines
Teaser: This multi-year study sheds light on the differences between vaccine formulations, and why vaccine types work better in some age groups than in others.

Headlines: Health Workers Gearing up for More H1N1 Cases in Fall
Teaser: Even Sunday sermons are preaching flu preparedness.

Headlines: H1N1 Flu (Swine Flu)
Teaser: Are your patients worried or confused about swine flu? This timely "Share with Women" article spells out what to tell them.

Headlines: 2009 H1N1 Influenza: Common Concerns -- Fall 2009
Teaser: In this video blog, Paul G. Auwaerter, MD, MBA, reviews current areas of concern with 2009 H1N1 influenza, including vaccine safety, vaccine supply, and difficult treatment decisions.

Headlines: Physicians Are Talking About: Is It Worth Getting the H1N1 Vaccine?
Teaser: Are you getting vaccinated against the swine flu? Medscape Physician Connect members debate their reasons for and reservations against receiving the vaccine.

Headlines: The Double Flu Vaccine Season Is Here -- Now What Should You Do?
Teaser: Sandra Fryhofer, MD, starts her new column "Staying Well" with an important summary of the most recent CDC recommendations for flu season.

Headlines: Human Lyme Disease Vaccines: Past and Future Concerns
Teaser: The pursuit of a human vaccine for Lyme disease, the most common arthropod-borne infection in the US, is an important and worthwhile endeavor, according to this review of the topic.

Headlines: Pregnant Women Are at Elevated Risk for Complications From H1N1 Flu
Teaser: Pregnant women seem to be at particularly high risk for complications from H1N1 influenza virus, according to early data from the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

Headlines: Influenza Immunization: Obligation or Option?
Teaser: First, do no harm. In this video blog, Paul G. Auwaerter, MD, MBA, offers an update on H1N1 vaccines and focuses on the need for healthcare workers to get immunized.

Headlines: H1N1 -- Who Are the Targets? And Who Gets the Vaccine?
Teaser: Sandra A. Fryhofer, MD, discusses the population targets for H1N1, prospects for vaccine availability, and current recommendations on treatments.

Headlines: Advice for College Students Facing H1N1 Flu
Teaser: Sandra A. Fryhofer, MD discusses the recommendations for H1N1 vaccinations and offers specific advice for college students.

Headlines: How Should I Manage the Pregnant HBeAg-Positive Woman?
Teaser: New 2009 guidelines address the management of the HBeAg-positive pregnancy.

Headlines: Hepatitis B-Related Hepatocellular Carcinoma
Teaser: HBV-related HCC incidence is projected to increase for at least 2 decades due to the high prevalence of chronic HBV infection and prolonged latency to HCC development.

Headlines: Novel H1N1 Influenza Practice Assessment
Teaser: Assess your influenza clinical practices in comparison with that of your peers with this questionnaire.

Headlines: Cervical Cancer and HIV-Infected Women: Focus on Resource-Limited Settings
Teaser: In resource-limited settings, the burden of cervical cancer and HIV is high, and clinicians struggle to screen and treat women at risk for cervical cancer.

Headlines: 2009-2010 H1N1: What's New This Week -- January 11, 2010
Teaser: As pandemic influenza wanes, we are learning more about it. John Bartlett, MD, comments on new data and the past week's H1N1 news and provides guidance to practicing clinicians.

Headlines: H1N1 Influenza: Results of a 2009 Season Practice Assessment
Teaser: Novel H1N1 is described by the WHO as a pandemic. To understand how 10,000 surveyed clinicians are managing influenza, read the results of a clinical practice self-assessment here.

Headlines: 2009-2010 H1N1: What's New This Week -- January 4, 2010
Teaser: As experts try to predict what influenza will do in the new year, John Bartlett, MD, comments on new data and the past week's H1N1 news and provides guidance to practicing clinicians.

Headlines: Attitudes Among Hospital Healthcare Workers Towards Seasonal Influenza
Teaser: Most healthcare workers acknowledge the importance of getting vaccinated against seasonal influenza, yet most remain unvaccinated, this study confirms.

Headlines: Innate Immune Evasion Strategies of Influenza Viruses
Teaser: The molecular details of the influenza virus-host interplay are discussed in this article as well as how researchers are using this information to design new vaccines and novel antivirals.

Headlines: HPV-16/18 Vaccine Effective for Longer Than 6 Years
Teaser: In this video blog, Dr. Maurie Markman discusses the persistent safety and efficacy of the HPV-16/18 vaccine, as indicated by a 6-year follow-up study.

Headlines: Effectiveness of 2008-09 Influenza Vaccine Against 2009 Influenza A (H1N1)
Teaser: Does the 2008-2009 seasonal influenza vaccine increase or decrease the risk for 2009 pandemic influenza A illness?

Headlines: CDC Commentary: Advice for Patients Traveling During Flu Season
Teaser: Phyllis Kozarsky, MD, offers video commentary on advising patients about safe and healthy travel, especially during flu season.

Headlines: HIV Treatment Guidelines: New Updates
Teaser: Don't miss this video blog: Paul E. Sax, MD, reviews the latest updates to HIV guidelines from WHO and DHHS - when to start, what to start with, special considerations for pregnancy, and more.

Headlines: Human Rabies -- Missouri, 2008
Teaser: A man is bitten by a bat, fails to seek treatment, and dies. This case highlights the need to raise public awareness of rabies, the CDC says.

Headlines: 2009 H1N1: What's New This Week -- December 14, 2009
Teaser: Although H1N1 is waning, John Bartlett comments on the past week's H1N1 news and provides guidance to practicing clinicians.

Headlines: Deaths Related to Influenza A (H1N1) in American Indian/Alaska Natives
Teaser: Pandemic influenza A (H1N1) has hit American Indian/Alaska Natives particularly hard, with death rates four times higher than in other groups.

Headlines: 2009 H1N1: What's New This Week -- December 7, 2009
Teaser: John Bartlett comments on the past week's H1N1 news and provides guidance to practicing clinicians.

Headlines: Bacterial Coinfections in Lung Tissue From Fatal Cases of H1N1 Influenza
Teaser: Bacterial coinfections, most commonly S. pneumoniae, are playing an important role in pandemic influenza A (H1N1) deaths.

Headlines: 2009 H1N1: What's New This Week -- December 1, 2009
Teaser: John Bartlett comments on the past week's H1N1 news and provides guidance to practicing clinicians.

Headlines: Influenza Vaccination Coverage in US Children and Adults, 2008-2009
Teaser: During last year's flu season, only approximately 20% of school-aged children were vaccinated against seasonal influenza, highlighting the need for increased attention to this age group.

Headlines: Public Health Officials Readying for Increase in H1N1 Influenza Cases
Teaser: An expected increase of H1N1 influenza this fall has federal health agencies and health leaders ramping up resources.

Headlines: Introduction and Transmission of 2009 Pandemic H1N1 Virus - Kenya
Teaser: Since introduction of pandemic H1N1 virus in Kenya in June 2009, the overall 26% secondary attack rate of the virus appears comparable to that of seasonal influenza.

Headlines: 2009 H1N1: What's New This Week -- Commentary by John G. Bartlett, MD
Teaser: John Bartlett comments on this week's H1N1 news.

Headlines: A Clear and Present Danger: Tick-Borne Diseases in Europe
Teaser: Tick-borne diseases are becoming an increasing and serious problem in Europe. This review highlights the most important circulating tick-transmitted pathogens in Europe.

Headlines: Recommended Adult Immunization Schedule
Teaser: How have recommendations for currently licensed vaccines for adults changed in 2010?

Headlines: BCG Vaccination and Leprosy Protection: Review of Current Evidence
Teaser: In light of recent research, the authors call for more emphasis on the role of BCG vaccination in leprosy control.

Headlines: Three Studies Demonstrate the Safety and Efficacy of H1N1 Flu Vaccine
Teaser: Results from H1N1 flu vaccine studies conducted in the US, China, and Hungary provide reassuring safety and efficacy information.

Headlines: Top 10 Infectious Disease Publications in 2009
Teaser: Review these not-to-be-missed infectious disease articles from 2009.

Headlines: Synopsis of Noteworthy FDA Approvals
Teaser: A useful overview of important drugs approved, recalled, and assigned new indications in 2009.

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: Decreased Incidence of Hepatocellular Carcinoma in Hepatitis B Vaccinees
Teaser: This study sought to determine whether prevention of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) by hepatitis B vaccination extended beyond childhood and to identify the predictors of HCC for those vaccinated.

Headlines: 2009-2010 H1N1: What's New This Week -- February 8, 2010
Teaser: John G. Bartlett, MD, comments on new data and the past week's H1N1 news and provides guidance to practicing clinicians.

Headlines: The 2010 Adult Immunization Schedule: Do You Know the New Changes?
Teaser: Sandra Fryhofer, MD, points out changes in the 2010 ACIP adult immunization schedule, including updated recommendations for healthcare workers.

Headlines: Intent to Receive Influenza A (H1N1) and Seasonal Influenza Vaccines
Teaser: In late August 2009, intent to receive the H1N1 and seasonal influenza vaccines among residents of two counties in North Carolina was high, but just how many followed through?

Headlines: Next Generation of Flu Vaccines Coming of Age
Teaser: With the reliability of a finely tuned clock, seasonal influenza returns each year. Not as reliable has been the availability of the most important tool for controlling flu: vaccines.

Headlines: Malaria Vaccine: Why is it Taking so Long?
Teaser: The hunt for an effective malaria vaccine has been on for over three decades, with little success thus far, but the tide may be turning.

Headlines: Currently Approved Prophylactic HPV Vaccines
Teaser: The most important determinant of a vaccine's ability to reduce cervical cancer is its duration of efficacy.

Headlines: 2009-2010 H1N1: What's New This Week -- January 25, 2010
Teaser: Pandemic H1N1 is winding down. John Bartlett, MD, comments on new data and the past week's H1N1 news and provides guidance to practicing clinicians.

Headlines: Overview, Prevention, and Treatment of Rabies
Teaser: Human rabies infection is usually fatal and universally feared. Recent issues regarding rabies virus transmission and recommendations for pre- and postexposure prophylaxis and treatment are discussed.

Headlines: T-Cell Responses to Influenza Vaccination in Patients With Heart Failure
Teaser: Do patients with CHF mount appropriate immune responses to the influenza vaccine?

Headlines: CDC Commentary: Guillain-Barré Syndrome (GBS) Surveillance
Teaser: Learn about CDC's Emerging Infections Program -- a comprehensive effort to better identify GBS.  James J. Sejvar, MD, describes this initiative and outlines how clinicians can help.

Headlines: How Virulent Is the 2009 Influenza A H1N1 (Swine Flu) Virus?
Teaser: The current pandemic H1N1 virus thus far has not proved to be as virulent as was initially feared, but flu viruses love cold dry air and winter weather has just set in many parts of the world.

Headlines: Surgeon General Commentary: Leading by Example to Fight H1N1
Teaser: In this video commentary, Dr. Regina M. Benjamin, Surgeon General, encourages health professionals to lead by example, getting H1N1 vaccinations themselves and recommending their patients do the same.

Headlines: John Bartlett's Postmortem on 2009 H1N1 (Influenza A): 10 Valuable Lessons
Teaser: We would all do well to heed these valuable lessons about 2009 H1N1 influenza when the next wave of influenza hits.

Headlines: CDC Commentary: New Safety Data on the HPV Vaccine -- Reassure Your Patients
Teaser: In this video commentary from the CDC, Dr. Claudia Velozzi reviews the most recent, and reassuring, safety data for Gardasil, the vaccine for HPV.

Headlines: H1N1 and Seasonal Influenza Vaccine Coverage Among Health Care Personnel
Teaser: Healthcare administrators who require influenza vaccination of their employees help boost coverage rates among healthcare personnel.

Headlines: CDC Commentary: The Pre-Travel Consultation -- What Providers Should Know
Teaser: In this video commentary from the CDC, Phyllis Kozarsky, MD, informs providers of the crucial elements of a pre-travel consultation for patients who are planning to travel abroad.

Headlines: Vaccine Safety: Current Controversies in the USA
Teaser: How safe are the common vaccines, and which cause the most controversy around the world?

Source: ISMP Medication Safety Alert!® Acute Care Edition
Headlines: DTaP-Tdap Mix-Ups Now Affecting Hundreds of Patients
Teaser: One is for active immunization; one is a booster. Do you know which is which?

Teaser: This report provides guidance on use of the newly-licensed quadrivalent meningococcal conjugate vaccine (Menveo).

Headlines: Switching from OPV to IPV: are we behind the schedule in Latin America?
Teaser: What is the best and most efficient polio vaccine available worldwide?

Headlines: ACIP Recommends Universal Influenza Immunization -- And It's About Time
Teaser: Sandra Fryhofer, MD, discusses the ACIP recommendations that everyone over 6 months be immunized against influenza. However, will there be enough of the vaccine?

Teaser: What community-level containment strategies worked best in the early stages of the 2009 pandemic influenza outbreak?

Teaser: How have recommendations for currently licensed vaccines for children aged 18 and younger changed in 2010?

Teaser: How did the first 99 people with laboratory confirmed H1N1 pandemic flu in New York City fare? A review of the medical charts provides some clues.

Teaser: On June 25, 2009, a naval ship docks in San Francisco and picks up unwanted cargo -- swine flu.

Headlines: COPD Management in Primary Care
Teaser: Four areas of improvement for the management of COPD are identified in this study.

Headlines: A Critical Look at Flu Vaccine Studies
Teaser: Influenza vaccine efficacy studies can yield misleading data if conducted at the wrong time.

Headlines: Safety of Influenza A (H1N1) 2009 Monovalent Vaccines
Teaser: As of the end of November, US safety data indicate no increase above background rates for monitored health events among influenza A (H1N1) recipients.

Source: Expert Review of Pharmacoeconomics & Outcomes Research
Headlines: Cancer Prevention: Major Initiatives and Looking Into the Future
Teaser: At least half of cancers are preventable. What prevention initiatives are currently underway?

Headlines: Vaccine-Preventable Diseases -- Roll Up Your Sleeves!
Teaser: In this video commentary, William Schaffner, MD, of IDSA, reviews why we need to educate adults about immunization and the benefit of getting vaccinated ourselves.

Headlines: Family Vaccination Practice Assessment
Teaser: In the vaccination assessment for 2010, we invite you to test your knowledge and assess your practice in comparison with your peers.

Headlines: Hypertension Highlights: Does It All Begin and End With ALLHAT?
Teaser: Seven years after the first presentation of ALLHAT, we report results of the largest-ever hypertension study and discuss the possible future of antihypertensive therapy. And then -- champagne for all?

Teaser: This new study looks at the prevalence of Guillain Barre syndrome after vaccination for H1N1.

Teaser: Read this new study to learn about the FDA's latest recommendations for the use of the HPV4 vaccine in men.

Teaser: What are the latest recommendations from the FDA for the use of the HPV2 vaccine in women?

Teaser: Do patients with egg allergy need a skin prick test before receiving the influenza vaccine?

Headlines: Factors Influencing Familial Decision-Making Regarding HPV Vaccination
Teaser: Why is the HPV vaccination rate so low in pre-adolescent and adolescent girls?

Headlines: Need-to-Know News About Influenza
Teaser: Read about the latest -- some unexpected, some welcome -- developments on the influenza front.

Headlines: Neutralizing Antibody to HIV: Exciting New Research
Teaser: What is the potential of new research on neutralizing antibody to HIV? Paul E. Sax, MD, offers his view of the latest reports and what they may mean for vaccine development and therapeutics.

Headlines: Progress Toward Interruption of Wild Poliovirus Transmission -- Worldwide, 2009
Teaser: What are the latest trends worldwide in poliomylitis prevention? This study reviews the data.

Teaser: Although herpes zoster vaccine is effective and well-tolerated, it is not routinely administered. Is the high cost a barrier?

Headlines: Vaccination as a Tool for Cancer Prevention
Teaser: Millions of people are affected every year by infection-induced cancer. Are you following these important recommendations aimed at preventing such cancers in your patients?
